context: The word 'tahab' is the third-person singular present indicative form of the Estonian verb 'tahtma', which means 'to want', 'to desire', or 'to intend'. It is used when referring to what a single person (he/she/it) currently wants or desires. The verb 'tahma' belongs to the -ma infinitive class in Estonian, and its present tense conjugation shows the third-person singular form as 'tahab'. This word appears frequently in everyday conversations when expressing someone's wishes, needs, or intentions.
